question: Choose the true statement.
answer1: If $T:\mathbb{R}^2\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is a linear transformation, then $T$ can be an injection.
answer2: If $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ is a linear transformation, then $T$ can be an injection.
answer3: If $T:\mathbb{R}^2\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is a linear transformation, then $T$ can be a sobrejection.
answer4: If $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is a linear transformation and $ker(T)\neq \left\{(0,0,0\right\}$, then $T$ can be a sobrejection.

question: Which of the following is not a requirement for a goal programming problem?

How many solutions does the following linear system have, with respect to $a\in\mathbb{R}$?
$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccc}
ax & + & y & + & 2az & = & a+5\\
ax & - & ay & - & z & = & a\\
x & - & ay & + & z & = & 3
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: One solution for $a\neq 1$, and no solutions for $a=1$.
answer2: One solution for $a\neq 1,-1$, no solutions for $a=1$ and infinitely many solutions for $a=-1$.
answer4: No solutions for $a\neq 0$, and one solution for $a=0$.

\[
\begin{array}{l|ccc|}
& S_1 & S_2 & S_3 \\
\hline
C_1 & 14 & 13 & 16 \\
C_2 &16 & 18  & 15 \\
C_3 & 15 & 17 & 11 \\
C_4 & 14 & 16  & 14 \\
\hline 
\end{array}
\]	

Assign the different candidates for the subjects, supposing that each teacher must have at least $14$ marks in the subject to teach and the school wants to maximize the sum of the marks concerning the admitted teachers.
answer1: Tied optimal solutions: $x_{13} = 1,  x_{21} = 1, x_{32} = 1 \text{, other },  x_{ij}=0~$ or $~x_{13} = 1,  x_{22} = 1, x_{31} = 1 \text{, other }  x_{ij}=0$;

question: What can we say about the relative extrema of the function $f:(0,\infty) \times (0,\infty)\rightarrow \mathbb R$ given by $f(x,y)= x^2+xy+y^2-4\ln (x) -10\ln( y)+3$?
answer1: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative minimizer.
answer2: The points $M(1,2)$ is a relative maximizer.
answer3: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative maximizer.
answer4: The points $M(2,1)$ and $N(1,2)$ are relative minimizer and respectively, relative maximizer.

answer1: The straight line which crosses the median points is a line of symmetry.
answer2: The sides are congruent two by two.

question: Differentiate $y = (2x^3 - 5x)^5$.
Find $\dfrac{\partial}{\partial x}( \cos(x) \tan(y-2x))$.
Differentiate $y=x^2 \sin(x)$.
Find the partial derivatives of the function $z(x,y)=x^4 e^{y^5}$.
answer1: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=4x^3 e^{y^5}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=5x^4y^4 e^{y^5} $
answer2: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=4x^5 e^{y^4}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=x^4 e^{y^5} y^4$
answer3: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=3x^3 e^{y^5}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=x^4 e^{y^5} 5y$
answer4: $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}(x,y)=x^3 e^{y^5}, \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}(x,y)=x^4 e^{y} 5y^4$

question: Consider the linear transformation $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$, such that $F(x, y)=(x+2y, 2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$.
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator.
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$.

Consider in the three-dimensional cartesian system the plane of equation $\pi: 2x-3y+z-1=0$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(-1, -1, 0)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(-4, 6, -2)$.
answer2: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, 3, 1)$.
answer3: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 1)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.
answer4: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, -1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.

question: A quadrilateral is a rectangle when
answer1: all four internal angles are congruent.
answer2: it has congruent internal angles two by two OR it has two pairs of congruent internal angles.
answer3: it has congruent sides two by two OR it has two pairs of congruent sides.
answer4: it has parallel sides two by two OR it has two pairs of parallel sides.

Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]	

Let $S_1$ and $S_2$ be the slack variables for the respective constraints. After we apply the simplex method, the final incomplete simplex tableau is:

\[
\begin{array}{l|ccccc|c}
& x_{1} & x_{2} & x_{3} &  S_{1} & S_{2} & \\
\hline
x_{1} & 1 & -1/3  & 0 &  1/3 & -1/3 & 5 \\
x_{3} & 0 & 1  & 1 &  -1/5 & 2/5 & 3 \\
\hline
& &   & &   & & \\
\end{array}
\]	

If  the available resource 1 decrease 10 units, determine the solution based on the final complete simplex tableau.
Choose the right answer:
answer1: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is an orthogonal linear operator
answer2: The translation function $F_v:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated to vector $v$ is a linear operator
answer3: The reflection function $F:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ around the line y = x, defined by $F(x,y)=(y, x)$ is a non-orthogonal linear operator
answer4: The rotation function  $F_\theta:\mathbb{R}^2\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ associated with the  $\theta$ angle is a non-orthogonal linear operator

x'(t)=2x+y \\
y'(t)=x+3y-z \\
z'(t)=-x+2y+3z
\end{cases}$
answer3:
$\begin{cases}
x(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+C_{2}e^{3t}(2\cos (t)-\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{3t}(\cos (t)+2\sin (t))\\
y(t)=C_{2}e^{3t}(\cos (t)+3\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{3t}(3\cos (t)-\sin (t))\\
z(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+2C_{2}e^{3t}\cos t+3C_{3}e^{3t}\sin t,
\end{cases}$
where $C_{1}, C_{2}, C_{3} \in \mathbb{R}$.
answer4:
$\begin{cases}
x(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+C_{2}e^{t}(2\cos (t)-\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{t}(\cos (t)+2\sin (t))\\
y(t)=C_{2}e^{t}(\cos (t)-3\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{t}(3\cos (t)+\sin (t))\\
z(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+5C_{2}e^{t}\cos (t)+5C_{3}e^{t}\sin (t),
\end{cases}$
where $C_{1}, C_{2}, C_{3} \in \mathbb{R}$.

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x_1 &- &x_2 &- &3x_3 &+ &4x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &x_2 &+ &x_3 &+ &2x_4 &= &-1 \\
& &- &x_2 &- &2x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &2x_2 &+ &3x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &-2
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has many solutions depending on two parameters:
$$(x_3-3x_4,-1-2x_3+x_4, x_3, x_4), \, \forall x_3,x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$
answer3:
The system has many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(1-3x_4,-1+x_4, 1, x_4), \, \forall x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$.
